alert.note: Alert for Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Gates; Hertford; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 9:18PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Camden, Pasquotank, Perquimans, southeastern Gates, Currituck and northwestern Chowan Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 918 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Sanderling to near Weeksville to near Ryland. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Currituck, Elizabeth City, Camden, Hertford, Winfall, Elizabeth City State University, Grandy, Ryland, Weeksville, Chapanoke, Tyner, Nixonton, Hobbsville, Shiloh, Belvidere, Indiantown, Corolla, Burgess, Old Trap and Whitehall Shores. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Gates; Hertford; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck
